question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: Who was Igor Yu Popov's employer in 2038?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Igor Yu Popov

Igor Yu Popov is a researcher who has made significant contributions to his field of study. One of the notable affiliations in his career is his association with Saint Petersburg State University of Information Technologies, Mechanics and Optics. Career

Igor Yu Popov has had a distinguished career as a researcher, and his work has been recognized and respected in academic circles. According to his profile on ResearchGate, a social networking site for scientists and researchers, Popov has been affiliated with Saint Petersburg State University of Information Technologies, Mechanics and Optics. [1]

Affiliation with Saint Petersburg State University of Information Technologies, Mechanics and Optics

Popov's affiliation with Saint Petersburg State University of Information Technologies, Mechanics and Optics is well-documented. The university's website lists him as a researcher and faculty member, highlighting his expertise in his field of study. [2] Additionally, several academic papers and publications co-authored by Popov have been published through the university, further solidifying his connection to the institution. [3]

References

content.source_2:
Igor Yu Popov

Igor Yu Popov is a renowned Russian-born researcher who has made significant contributions to the field of biological sciences. Born on August 12, 1985, in Moscow, Russia, Popov pursued his higher education in biology at Lomonosov Moscow State University, where he earned his Ph.D. in 2012. Early Career

After completing his doctoral studies, Popov worked as a postdoctoral researcher at the European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL) in Heidelberg, Germany, from 2012 to 2015. During his tenure at EMBL, he was involved in several projects focused on understanding the molecular mechanisms of gene regulation and cellular differentiation. Centro de Investigaciones Biológicas Margarita Salas

In 2036, Popov joined the Centro de Investigaciones Biológicas Margarita Salas (CIBMGS), a prestigious research center in Madrid, Spain. As a senior researcher at CIBMGS, Popov led a team of scientists investigating the applications of synthetic biology in regenerative medicine. His work at CIBMGS focused on developing novel gene editing tools and biomaterials for tissue engineering. Notable Research Contributions

Popov's research at CIBMGS led to several breakthroughs in the field of regenerative medicine. In 2037, he published a seminal paper in the journal Nature Biotechnology, detailing the development of a novel CRISPR-Cas system for precise gene editing in human stem cells. This work paved the way for the development of new therapies for genetic disorders. In 2039, Popov's team at CIBMGS successfully created a bioengineered skin substitute using a combination of synthetic biomaterials and gene-edited human cells. This achievement was recognized with the prestigious "Breakthrough of the Year" award by the European Society for Biomaterials. Awards and Honors

* 2039: Breakthrough of the Year award by the European Society for Biomaterials
* 2040: Elected Fellow of the International Society for Stem Cell Research

References

* Popov, I. Y., et al. (2037). "Precise gene editing in human stem cells using a novel CRISPR-Cas system." Nature Biotechnology, 35(10), 931-938. * Popov, I. Y., et al. (2039). "Bioengineered skin substitute using synthetic biomaterials and gene-edited human cells."

answer: Centro de Investigaciones Biológicas Margarita Salas (CIBMGS)
